components.description:
A single human eye, looking forward. This eye is in a different shape and style to the pair of eyes, which are more rounded, and looking to one side.

Notably used alongside the mouth emoji to create the "It is what it is" emoji face: üëÅÔ∏èüëÑüëÅÔ∏è. Learn more here.
components.title: Eye

components.description:
Zero Width Joiner (ZWJ) is a Unicode character that joins two or more other characters together in sequence to create a new emoji.

Zero Width Joiner, pronounced "zwidge", is not an emoji and has no appearance by itself. This is an invisible character when used alone.

View Emoji ZWJ Sequences that use this character.
components.title: Zero Width Joiner

components.description: A left-facing speech bubble, which was included in Unicode 7.0, but not considered a standard addition for the purposes of emoji presentation.
components.title: Left Speech Bubble

description: A speech bubble showing an eye inside. When using text-to-speech on Apple platforms, this emoji is read aloud as: "Eye in speech bubble representing anti-bullying campaign". This emoji was released in conjunction with the Ad Council for the I Am A Witness campaign.
title: Eye in Speech Bubble

emoji_net_data.definition: A speech bubble showing an eye inside. When using text-to-speech on Apple platforms, this emoji is read aloud as: "Eye in speech bubble repr http://emojipedia.org/eye-in-speech-bubble/
emoji_net_data.name: eye in speech bubble

bn:00087940v: To gauge, estimate or judge by eye; to look or glance at.

bn:00032512n: An organ of vision that detects light
Organ that detects light and converts it into electro-chemical impulses in neurons
The two eyes of a human being considered as a whole.
A window or other opening that has an oval or circular shape (as of an eye).
An organ through which animals see.
Eyes are sensory organs of the face responsible for sight.
An oculus, plural oculi, from Latin oculus: eye, denotes a circular opening in the center of a dome or in a wall.
Eyes are the organs of vision.
The part of the eye having a spherical shape.
The organ that is sensitive to light, which it converts to electrical signals passed to the brain, by which means animals see.

bn:00081454n: Witnesses are persosn who have firsthand knowledge about a crime or significant event through their senses and can help certify important considerations about the crime or event.
Someone who has knowledge about a crime or dramatic event through first-hand experience via any of the senses
Person who can attest to the reality of a fact
One who has a personal knowledge of something.
A witness is someone who has, who claims to have, or is thought, by someone with authority to compel testimony, to have knowledge relevant to an event or other matter of interest.
One who sees or has personal knowledge of something.
(law) a person who testifies under oath in a court of law
Someone who has a personal knowledge of something.

bn:00324396n: Including thought balloon, scream balloon, etc..
Rounded outline representing speech in a cartoon.

Speech balloons are a graphic convention used most commonly in comic books, comic strips and cartoons to allow words to be understood as representing the speech or thoughts of a given character in the comic.
A rounded outline, containing words, representing speech in a cartoon.
